intro: Pleurothallis ellipsophylla, commonly known as the elliptic-leaf pleurothallis, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a small, epiphytic orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. The plant typically grows on trees and has narrow, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are small and usually pale green or white, with a distinctive lip that is often more brightly colored. It is valued in horticulture for its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
